title: Write test for link with multiple collisions and different friction coefficients

content.raw:
Bullet is currently setting friction in a hacky way (see [BulletLink.cc:159](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/8c0503b74a57503cd69bbcaee15479daeec22b58/gazebo/physics/bullet/BulletLink.cc#cl-159) and comments in pull request #1420) at the link level rather than the collision level.

We should write a test of a link with multiple collision shapes and different friction coefficients on each collision. For example, a box with the spherical collision shapes for feet sliding on a plane. If the friction coefficients aren't equal, it should cause some rotation of the body as it slides.
content.html:
Bullet is currently setting friction in a hacky way (see BulletLink.cc:159 and comments in pull request #1420) at the link level rather than the collision level.

We should write a test of a link with multiple collision shapes and different friction coefficients on each collision. For example, a box with the spherical collision shapes for feet sliding on a plane. If the friction coefficients aren't equal, it should cause some rotation of the body as it slides.
